Role / Responsibilities:

Methodology Delivery Team

We are looking for a highly-motivated individual to join as Assistant Vice President-Delivery Manager in the Methodology Delivery Team. The Team is responsible for methodology project delivery using agile principles according to plan and scope.

The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Creating and leading positive
column137:
and supported working group environments
  • Driving scrum meetings and delivering successful results on a timely and consistent basis
  • Facilitating working group discussion
column139:
and conflict resolution
  • Proactively assessing and managing project risks and mitigation plans
  • Driving communication
column141:
and radiating information amongst stakeholders
  • Continuous coaching and training working groups in agile and lean principles
  • Tracking and reporting progress and dependencies
column142:
proactively identifying roadblocks and removing impediments
  • Supporting management with periodic and ad-hoc reporting
  • Managing working group commitments and deliverables

    • Qualifications:

    • Bachelor’s degree required preferably in business or technology.
    • Eight to ten years of experience in managing complex
column143:
global and fast-paced cross functional projects following agile principles.
  • Strong communications skills (oral and written) including experience in moderating working group sessions for consensus building.
  • Excellent judgement and problem-solving skills
column145:
inter-team conflict sessions.
  • Exceptional organizational skills and ability to be agile and handle multiple projects and timelines while being detail oriented.
  • Strong team player with the ability to work independently - proactive
column148:
with the highest ethical standards.
  • High level of personal initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Proficiency in Agile Project Management tools (Jira
column149:
Confluence).
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel
column151:
Word and Teams.
  • Scrum master certification is a plus
column152:
but not essential.

About the Team

The financial modeling team
column338: part of Model Development group building world’s best catastrophe models
column339: focus on providing end-to-end solutions to analyzing the financial impact of RMS’s catastrophe models. Our responsibility includes building analytical and simulation models for financial contracts and metrics for portfolio analysis
column342: building prototypes on distributed environment and implementing production software on AWS based SaaS platform. Our scope also includes supply chain modelling and simulation
column343: machine learning applications in exposure data analysis
column344:
such as image analysis and large dataset mining using deep learning and classical machine learning tools. We also perform applied research in these areas.     

 

Senior Software Engineer

We are looking for a Senior Scientific Programmer to join a growing team of developers and modelers. We are seeking someone who is excited about tackling complex software challenges and solving difficult business problems.

As a senior programmer
column345: you are expected to be proficient writing production quality code in an object-oriented language. You must be able to dive into any existing code.  You must be a strong team player
column346: contributing ideas and taking constructive critical feedback. You should be able to work independently
column347:
juggling multiple items concurrently while contributing to multiple areas within a large project.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 3+ years of programming experience; proven track record of on-time delivery
  • Experience writing production-level code in C#
column349:
or C++.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
  • Familiarity with probability and statistics.
  • Master’s degree in STEM field.

    • Preferred Skills and Experience:

    • Experience in linear programming applications.
    • 5+ years of programming experience
    • Experience in performance tuning and bottleneck analysis
    • Python experience
    • Machine learning experience.

Role/Responsibilities:

The Digital Insights OU is hiring for an initiative to increase recognition of Moody’s value proposition among a wide range of financial market participants by providing highest level of financials data governance and ensure data quality and usability of our products.

The Data Operations Specialist will work within an initiative focused in analyzing published financial documents of corporate entities around the globe. The role will leverage competency in accounting
column398: and financial statement analysis to extract relevant data and insights from published documents. The ideal candidate will possess a goal-oriented mindset
column399: an interest in growing their competency and career
column400: and a desire to collaborate with a global team
column401:
particularly partnering with the Data Operations Lead/SME and the Data Operations Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzing and extracting data
column403:
and other information from financial documents
  • Reviewing financial documents which include Income Statement
column404:
Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Statement from the annual/interim and regulatory statements of entities across the world
  • Knowledge of US GAAP
column407:
is required (knowledge of several and others is a bonus)
  • Conducting detailed quality checks of own work
column408:
as well as others is required
  • Adhering to timeliness deadlines with quality output is a primary characteristic of the work
  • Ability to work independently and in a global team
    • Qualifications :

    Bachelor's degree in Accounting
column411:
or related field required

Languages:

  • English: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Spanish: Advanced written and verbal command

Skills and Experience

  • 1-3 years of experience of analyzing financial statements
  • Advanced understanding of various company filings (10K
column413:
Solvency reports) and should be comfortable with secondary research

The Data Solutions division is the commercial data business of Moody’s Analytics
column641: bringing together a vast catalogue of data to help business decision-makers assess risks and opportunities. We are best known for Orbis
column642: the world’s most comprehensive database of public and private companies. We are also the definitive source of ratings-related data for companies and securities that have been rated by Moody’s Investors Service. We strive to deliver convenience and insight to our customers by eliminating the hassle of sourcing
column644: adding value when decisions need to be made. Any analytical activity depends on reliable and accessible data
column645:
and we are proud to be a mission-critical information resource for decision-makers around the world. 
Are you a forward-thinking and agile learner keen on being part of a dynamic shift from batch processing to real-time stream processing? 
Join our vibrant team as a Junior Java Software Engineer
column646: where you'll be at the forefront of ingesting diverse data domains into cutting-edge NoSQL datastores and Elasticsearch using Apache Kafka and Apache Flink. This role offers an incredible opportunity to learn and grow rapidly in a dynamic
column647:
tech-driven environment.

column649:
and Apache Flink.

column652:
and reliability enhancements.

column653:
ensuring seamless error handling for uninterrupted stream processing operations.

ensuring high data integrity.

column656:
or a related field.

and Elasticsearch.
